DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name of a surgical procedure used to resection or remove a portion of a brain lesion.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brain Malignant Neoplasm Extent Surgical Resection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the quantity or range for tissue removal of part of the brain performed during an operative treatment for a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon. It is derived from the anterior part of the embryonic neural tube. Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:(ree-SEK-shun) Removal of tissue or part or all of an organ by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: revised for unique value set for Brain cancer; other Dz using similar CDE

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of brain surgical resection performed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of a lobe of the brain.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a lobe of the brain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An X-ray procedure using multiple coordinates to precisely determine the location of a tumor or nodule so as to obtain a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A biopsy procedure that uses 3-dimensional imaging to localize a lesion and guide the removal of a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated system generated definition with current NCIt definition. mc 11/12/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The excision of the vertebral posterior arch.

Concepts.definition: The excision of one or more vertebral posterior arches to alleviate pressure on the spinal cord or nerves.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical creation of an opening of the skull.

Concepts.definition: Surgical creation of an opening of the skull.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To destroy tissue using a hot or cold instrument, an electrical current, or a chemical that burns or dissolves the tissue. This process may be used to kill certain types of small tumors or to seal off blood vessels to stop bleeding.

Concepts.definition: To destroy tissue using a hot or cold instrument, an electrical current, or a chemical that burns or dissolves the tissue. This process may be used to kill certain types of small tumors or to seal off blood vessels to stop bleeding.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: revised for unique value set for Brain cancer; other Dz using similar CDE

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR study of brain cancer BTTC11, a study being run also at MD Anderson, so the lists of values and semantics are created exactly to support that trial. 11.13.2015. dmr.
